subject: Design
title: The iPhone: Touch Changes Everything
description: A micro-lesson that makes The iPhone: Touch Changes Everything usable.

hook.text: In 2007, phones had tiny keyboards and styluses. Apple asked: what if your finger was enough?

buildup.text: The iPhone eliminated nearly every physical button. The screen became the entire interface.

discovery.text: Multi-touch meant pinching, swiping, and tapping â€” gestures humans already knew.

twist.text: Competitors mocked it. Within three years, every major phone copied the design.

climax.text: The iPhone didn't just redesign the phone. It redesigned how humans interact with computers.

punchline.text: The best interface disappears under your fingertip.

quiz.question: What was the iPhone's fundamental design innovation?
